DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate clinical , echocardiographic angiographic outcome distal protection infarct relate coronary artery implantation drug elute versus bare metal stent patient ST-elevation myocardial infarction treat acutely percutaneous coronary intervention .
DOC.brief_title: Drug Elution Distal Protection During Percutaneous Coronary Intervention ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction
DOC.criteria: Acute onset typical chest pain < 12 hour ' duration STelevation > 4 mm ( 1mm = 0.1 mV ) contiguous lead electrocardiogram High grade stenosis occlusion native major coronary artery cross soft intermediate tip guidewire Possibility perform distal protection infarctrelated artery History previous myocardial infarction Use fibrinolytic agent index infarction Left main stenosis Heavily calcification abdominal aorta occlusive iliofemoral disease hamper access coronary ostias femoral route Known renal failure Other significant cardiac disease Other severe disease expect survival < 1 year Known allergy clopidogrel contrast medium avoided/limited medication Linguistic difficulty need interpreter Gastrointestinal bleeding within 1 month Childbearing potential pregnancy Participation another study
